channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox outside 72- 74 Edendale Road, 16th December
item.description:
Please can the fox be removed from the pavement asap. It was spotted this morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edendale Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter all over street and pavement, 16th December
item.description:
Litter and recycling rubbish strewn all over the street and pavement along the south side of Dunsmure Road. This happens each Tuesday during recycling pick up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunsmure Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in a waste area next to alley way, 16th December
item.description:
The rubbish was here this morning don’t regularly use the alley just happened to see it today looks like a fridge etc, it’s a bit of land next to alleyway and the fence has been broken down

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shearwood Crescent, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 16th December
item.description:
This is Sunday morning 7th December 2025 I noticed extra rubbish on the bins That was not there the day before. I rewound my camera to have a look. At 6:20pm on Saturday the 6th a Small white van (Could have been any colour as my cameras only show b&w after dark) Come from the direction of hexagons estate did a 3 point turnaround and parked next to the bins. There was some activity between the van and the bins for about 5 - 10 minutes The driver got back in van and reversed onto the main road causing other traffic to stop. It drove up the hill in the direction of Woolwich

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kings Highway, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox still there this morning, 16th December
item.description:
I had seen seen what looked like a large pile of leaves and dirt. Now they have swept the road you can see it is a squashed fox, but very dirty after all the muck that has been over it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Pauls Cray Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelchair has been left in the road near kerb., 16th December
item.description:
The wheelchair has been there for over 24 hours. Poses a potential risk of damage to a vehicle when parking once dark as it's unlikely to be seen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martin's Road, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish on f/way Erith Rd, B'Heath both sides of railway, 16th December
item.description:
Rubbish on Erith Road the path over the railway both sides - DA7 - she did not leave name or number and said if its not done she will contact local MP - advised that someone might need to call to get exact location - she stated that is the exact location there is only one
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 232, Erith Road, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping in skip, 16th December
item.description:
I am doing building works and have taken out a permit to put a skip on the road outside of 2 Farrin’s Rents. Yesterday in the morning of 15 December I saw that someone had fly-tipped a double bed (frame and mattress) and another mattress in the skip.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Globe Pond Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Spilt paint on road, 16th December
item.description:
One of the residents on Forest Way has driven through paint and then driven up the road. As the paint is on the rear driver’s tyre it has created “false” lane divider lines up the middle of the road, which are dangerous. The resident has tried to wash the paint off their drive and created a mess along the kerb of the road too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Forest Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Always trash and dog waste- ideally we move the buns, 16th December
item.description:
Kids walking to school everyday constantly have to jump around garbage, dog waste snd broken glass. My little one always steps in it and it’s dangerous for the kids then walking into school wearing shoes with waste on it all day (pre-schoolers sit on the floor etc). Not nice for the community

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
